content:
Certainly, there are many savory dishes that can incorporate the cacao and chili pairing. Here are a few ideas for you:

1. Mole sauce: A classic Mexican sauce made with a variety of chili peppers and chocolate, Mole is rich and flavorful, and goes well with chicken, beef, or vegetables.

2. Chili con carne: Add a dash of unsweetened cocoa powder to your chili recipe for an added depth of flavor. The cacao will complement the heat of the chili and provide a complex taste experience.

3. Cacao rub for meat: Use a mix of cacao powder, chili powder, and spices to create a dry rub to marinate your steak, pork or chicken before grilling or roasting. The heat and chocolatey notes will create a delicious flavor profile.

4. Cacao chili hummus: Add a tablespoon of unsweetened cacao powder and a dash of chili powder to your homemade hummus recipe for a unique and flavorful appetizer or snack.

Hope these ideas help you create some delicious and interesting dishes with cacao and chili.
